ServiceTemplate.templateName: Deploy VMware Cluster with iSCSI Storage
ServiceTemplate.templateDescription: Create two hosts, install ESXi hypervisors to SD cards on physical servers, provision storage, create cluster

parameters.toolTip: Device where volume will be created
Authentication method for storage volume
Comma separated list of IPs or IQNs

parameters.displayName: Add to VMware Storage DRS Cluster

parameters.toolTip: Device where volume will be created
Authentication method for storage volume
Comma separated list of IPs or IQNs

parameters.displayName: Add to VMware Storage DRS Cluster

parameters.toolTip: Use the Host Name Template field to auto-generate host names at deployment time. If not selected, a unique host name will be requested when the template is deployed.

Template used to generate host names at deployment time. Must contain variables that will produce a unique host name. Allowed variables are ${num} (an auto-generated unique number), ${service_tag}, ${model}, ${vendor} and ${dns} (ASM-assigned static IP will be resolved to hostname by DNS lookup).
Location of OS image installation files
OS administrator password set on the installed OS

options.name: (GMT) Greenwich Mean Time: Dublin, Edinburgh, Lisbon, London
(GMT+01:00) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna
(GMT+02:00) Helsinki, Kiev, Riga, Sofia, Tallinn, Vilnius

options.value: Transitional Islamic State of Afghanistan Standard Time
options.name: (GMT+04:30) Kabul
(GMT+08:00) Beijing, Chongqing, Hong Kong SAR, Urumqi
(UTC-04:00) Georgetown, La Paz, Manaus, San Juan
(UTC+01:00) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna
(UTC+02:00) Helsinki, Kyiv, Riga, Sofia, Tallinn, Vilnius

parameters.toolTip: ESXi, Windows, and Linux services support multiple NTP servers. NTP addresses must be separated by commas.
RAID controller will be put in the appropriate mode and automatically configured based on VMware vSAN best practices.

options.name: SD with RAID enabled for VMWare vSAN

parameters.toolTip:
Local Hard Drive - ASM creates a RAID with the local HDDs and installs the OS to this RAID array.

SD w/ RAID enabled - Enables SD, sets boot the SD, creates the specified RAID config which will not be the boot device.

SD w/ RAID disabled - Enables SD, sets boot the SD, disables RAID controller.

None - will not configure the boot device or boot order.

None (w/ RAID Configuration) - will not configure the boot device or boot order, but will create the RAID virtual disk.
Method for server selection
Pool from which servers are selected during deployment
Select specific server from a drop-down list
If selected server fails, retry on another available server
Allows the Maximum Transfer Unit (MTU) to be set in the server Operating System. This will only take effect on bonded interfaces.
Pool from which virtual identities are selected during deployment
Use the Host Name Template field to auto-generate host names at deployment time. If not selected, a unique host name will be requested when the template is deployed.

Template used to generate host names at deployment time. Must contain variables that will produce a unique host name. Allowed variables are ${num} (an auto-generated unique number), ${service_tag}, ${model}, ${vendor} and ${dns} (ASM-assigned static IP will be resolved to hostname by DNS lookup).
Location of OS image installation files
OS administrator password set on the installed OS

RAID controller will be put in the appropriate mode and automatically configured based on VMware vSAN best practices.

options.name: SD with RAID enabled for VMWare vSAN

parameters.toolTip:
Local Hard Drive - ASM creates a RAID with the local HDDs and installs the OS to this RAID array.

SD w/ RAID enabled - Enables SD, sets boot the SD, creates the specified RAID config which will not be the boot device.

SD w/ RAID disabled - Enables SD, sets boot the SD, disables RAID controller.

None - will not configure the boot device or boot order.

None (w/ RAID Configuration) - will not configure the boot device or boot order, but will create the RAID virtual disk.
Method for server selection
Pool from which servers are selected during deployment
Select specific server from a drop-down list
If selected server fails, retry on another available server
Allows the Maximum Transfer Unit (MTU) to be set in the server Operating System. This will only take effect on bonded interfaces.
Pool from which virtual identities are selected during deployment

RAID-1 (Mirroring) in Virtual SAN employs a 2n+1 host or fault domain algorithm, where n is the number of failures to tolerate.

RAID-5/6 (Erasure Coding) in Virtual SAN employs a 3+1 or 4+2 host or fault domain requirement, depending on 1 or 2 failures to tolerate respectively. RAID-5/6 (Erasure Coding) does not support 3 failures to tolerate
